body:
NVIDIA released its HPC SDK today. It includes the ex-PGI compilers which have been rebranded `nvc`, `nvc++` and `nvfortran`.

How do you plan to accommodate this rebranding? Should we keep using the NVIDIA compilers as PGI compilers or should it be new compilers (which might break existing packages since "%pgi" wouldn't catch those although it will probably be needed in most cases)?
title: PGI compilers integration in NVIDIA HPC SDK
